sen.e: He was MINAMOTO no Yoshiyuki's son and his secular name was MINAMOTO no Tomoyuki.

sen.j: 曾祖父源光行によって始められ、祖父源親行の代にほぼ完成した「源氏物語」の注釈書「水原抄」に加筆、また「原中最秘抄」を完成して源氏学（『源氏物語』を探求する学問）の権威として家学の隆盛に力を尽くした。
sen.e: He made additional corrections to the commentary known as "Suigen-sho Commentary" on "The Tale of Genji," the work that his great-grandfather MINAMOTO no Mitsuyuki had started to compile and his grandfather MINAMOTO no Chikayuki had almost completed, and he also completed "Genchu saihisho" (Secret Notes of the Suigen-sho).

sen.e: He made additional corrections to the commentary known as 'Suigen-sho Commentary' on "The Tale of Genji," the work that his great-grandfather MINAMOTO no Mitsuyuki had started to compile and his grandfather MINAMOTO no Chikayuki had almost completed, and he also completed 'Genchu saihisho' (Secret Notes of the Suigen-sho).

sen.j: このようにして、源氏学（『源氏物語』を探求する学問）の権威として家学の隆盛に力を尽くし、親行が藤原定家の勧めによって著した仮名遣いの書を増補して「仮名文字遣」を著した
sen.e: In this way, he made his efforts to further develop the family' hereditary learning as the leading authority in the studies of the Minamoto clan and he wrote "Kana mojizukai" (Usage of the Japanese syllabary symbols) by revising the book on the Japanese syllabic usage that Chikayuki wrote, recommended by FUJIWARA no Teika.
